Install Hich and its dependencies

This guide shows how to install Hich’s dependencies using mamba.

  1. Nextflow

  2. A container management system like Docker or, for shared computing environments, Singularity/Apptainer.

  3. Squashfuse, an up-to-date version of OpenJDK, pip and the Hich CLI utilities.

Note

Nextflow, and therefore Hich, is primarily designed to be run on Linux or macOS, but can be installed on Windows via WSL. These instructions have been tested on Linux and may need adaptation to other operating systems. See Nextflow’s installation instructions for details.

Note

Assuming most users will run Hich on a shared computing environment, this documentation uses singularity. However, Nextflow supports many container management systems and it should be possible to use any of them Hich as long as it’s compatible with your computing environment.

Note

Hich uses the container management system to install further dependencies the first time you run it. It can be configured to permanently store these additional dependencies in a centralized location with the .cacheDir setting in the nextflow.config file. See Nextflow’s container documentation for more details.

Create the hich environment and install dependencies

mamba create -qy -n hich bioconda::nextflow conda-forge::singularity conda-forge::squashfuse conda-forge::openjdk=21 pip && mamba activate hich && pip install hich

You can activate this environment with mamba activate hich

Note

mamba and conda can be used interchangeably, but mamba is typically faster.

Download the Hich pipeline

Create a directory where the hich pipeline code will be stored, go there, then clone it from github.

mkdir ~/hich && cd ~/hich
git clone https://github.com/bskubi/hich && cd hich
